alert.note: Alert for Howell; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 6:28PM CDT until April 20 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Howell County in south central Missouri... Southeastern Texas County in south central Missouri... * Until 930 PM CDT. * At 628 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, streets and other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Willow Springs and Arroll. This includes the following low water crossings... Elevin Point River at Highway U, South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road, North Prong Jacks Fork at Arroll Road and Eleven Point River at County Road 1550. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
